intro: Crotalaria goodiiformis, commonly known as the goodiiform crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in shrubland and grassland habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its seeds are encased in a hard pod, and it has a reputation for being toxic to livestock due to the presence of pyrrolizidine alkaloids.
